name: Clin T Melanoma Larynx Glottic
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  TNM does not include an in situ category for mucosal melanoma tumors. Assign 88 and behavior code /2 for in situ tumors.

**Note 2:**  Mucosal melanomas are aggressive tumors, therefore, T1 and T2 are omitted, as are Stages I and II. 

**Note 3:**  Assign T3 for localized tumor when no other information is available or for extension involving the mucosa only of adjacent sites.

**Note 4:**  Assign T4a or T4b for extension involving the deeper tissues of the primary or adjacent sites.
footnotes: *T4 is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use "Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles" as T4.
rows:
Clinical evaluation performed but unknown results or extension not stated
Clinical evaluation performed but results not documented in patient record
Tumor limited to the epithelium and/or submucosa (mucosal disease)

Tumor confined to mucosa only:
    Glottis, NOS
    Intrinsic larynx
    Laryngeal commissure(s), anterior, posterior
    Vocal cord(s), NOS, true vocal cord(s), true cord(s)
WITH normal vocal cord mobility

Mucosal tumor confined to vocal cords

Extension involving mucosa only of adjacent region(s) of larynx:
   Subglottis
   Supraglottis:
       Aryepiglottic fold
       Arytenoid cartilage:
             Corniculate tubercle
             Cuneiform tubercle
      Ventricular bands (false vocal cord(s))

Extension involving mucosa only of adjacent regions:
    Base of tongue
    Hypopharynx, NOS
    Pre-epiglottic tissues
    Postcricoid area
    Pyriform sinus
    Vallecula

Localized, NOS

Stated as T3

Note: T4 has subcategories of T4a and T4b. Assign T4 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories.

Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles

Stated as T4[NOS]

Tumor invades: 
     Deep soft tissue
     Cartilage
     Bone
     Overlying skin

Involvement of deep tissues of any structures in T3
Involvement of any structures in T3 WITH impaired vocal cord mobility
Involvement of deep tissue or musculature of structures in T3 WITH or WITHOUT vocal impairment or fixation of larynx or NOS
Minor thyroid cartilage erosion (inner cortex)
Paraglottic space
Soft tissue, NOS

Extension to/through:
    Cricoid cartilage
    Thyroid cartilage except minor erosion

    Oropharynx
    Skin
    Soft tissue of neck
    Strap muscles:
        Omohyoid
        Sternohyoid
        Sternothyroid
        Thyrohyoid
    Thyroid gland
    Trachea

Cervical esophagus
Deep extrinsic muscle(s) of tongue

Stated as T4a

Tumor invades any of the following:
    Brain
    Dura
    Skull base
    Lower cranial nerves (IX, X, XI, XII)
    Masticator space
    Carotid artery

    Mediastinal structures

    Mediastinal structures
   
Stated as T4b
In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM
